result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stacey Lynell Solomon

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Stacey Lynell Solomon appeared by video.  Attorney Haley E Wentz in court for Stacey Lynell Solomon.  Attorney Alexander James Geocaris in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a scheduling conference. Defense is requesting adjourned status date to determine case posture. Defendant's phone number is updated. Court adjourns matter for a status conference. Case adjourned to Branch 11.
Status conference scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 12 pages) commencing 09-28-2022 by Amy De La Rosa.

Attorney Haley E Wentz in court with Stacey Lynell Solomon, via zoom.  Attorney Gregg Herman in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM. Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  Officer Kevin Hansen, Milwaukee Police Department. Court took judicial notice of certified documents regarding case 2018CF4488. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 11.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Stacey Lynell Solomon in court by video.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court orders defendant TO JUSTICE POINT for Level 4 supervision.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON (8/3/2022). IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Stacey Lynell Solomon in court with attorney Brett Lee Copeland.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Franke, Branch 25.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 8/1/22 @ 2p
